item.title: pythonTest
item.description: Here we go. Let’s create a ggplot first and then we’ll try the same with matplotlib key_crops %>% group_by(country) %>% summarise(avg = mean(wheat_tonnes_per_hectare, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% arrange(desc(avg)) %>% head(10) %>% ggplot(aes(country, avg)) + geom_col() Now try the same in Python.. import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt p_df = pd.read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-09-01/key_crop_yields.csv') p_df.head() ## Entity ... Bananas (tonnes per hectare) ## 0 Afghanistan ... NaN ## 1 Afghanistan .
